content.description: Because library books are read many times, glue is often applied to the spine of a book to keep the pages tight. A glue is considered successful if a book lasts at least 6 months before needing to be reglued. Two brands of glue, G and K, were tested to determine whether there was a difference in the proportion of books lasting at least 6 months. Let <math alttext="p sub G" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the proportion of books lasting at least 6 months when glued with G, and let <math alttext="p sub K" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> represent the proportion of books lasting at least 6 months when glued with K. The following hypothesis test was conducted at the significance level of <math alttext="alpha equals 0.01" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>0.01</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>.
content.question: <math alttext="H sub 0: p sub G equals P sub K. H sub a: p sub G is not equal to p sub K" display="block" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtable><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr><mtr><mtd><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mtext>a</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>≠</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>K</mtext></mrow></msub></mtd></mtr></mtable></mrow></mstyle></math> All conditions for inference were met, and the resulting <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value was 0.006. Which of the following is the correct decision for the test?

choices.label: The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is less than <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the null hypothesis is rejected. There is not convincing evidence to support the claim that the proportion of books lasting at least 6 months when glued with G is different from the proportion of books lasting at least 6 months when glued with K.

The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is less than <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the null hypothesis is rejected. There is convincing evidence to support the claim that the proportion of books lasting at least 6 months when glued with G is different from the proportion of books lasting at least 6 months when glued with K.

The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is less than <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the null hypothesis is not rejected. There is not convincing evidence to support the claim that the proportion of books lasting at least 6 months when glued with G is different from the proportion of books lasting at least 6 months when glued with K.

The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is greater than <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the null hypothesis is rejected. There is convincing evidence to support the claim that the proportion of books lasting at least 6 months when glued with G is different from the proportion of books lasting at least 6 months when glued with K.

The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is greater than <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the null hypothesis is not rejected. There is not convincing evidence to support the claim that the proportion of books lasting at least 6 months when glued with G is different from the proportion of books lasting at least 6 months when glued with K.

content.answer: The <math alttext="p" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-value is less than <math alttext="alpha" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>α</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>, and the null hypothesis is rejected. There is convincing evidence to support the claim that the proportion of books lasting at least 6 months when glued with G is different from the proportion of books lasting at least 6 months when glued with K.

topic.text: 6.11: Carrying Out a Test for the Difference of Two Population Proportions

skill.text: Skill 4.E: Justify a claim using a decision based on significance tests.
